thread.title: Kim Chance, former WA ALP minister, dies at the age of 70 - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Kim Chance, former WA ALP minister, dies at the age of 70 - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

author: David Weber
title: Kim Chance, former WA ALP minister, dies at the age of 70 - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Map: Perth 6000 
Former WA Labor minister Kim Chance has died. 
Mr Chance was in office from 1992 through to 2008 as a member of the Legislative Council representing the Agricultural Region. 
He held the ministerial posts of fisheries, forestry, the Mid West, agriculture and food, and Wheatbelt and Great Southern in the Gallop and Carpenter governments. 
More recently, Mr Chance was the chair of the Fishing Industry Council and the Australian Landcare Council. 
He was the principal of Gulf Australia Trading, and chair of Dandaragan Camel Dairies, and had been a food security adviser to the Abu Dhabi Government. 
Mr Chance was married with two adult children. 
He was 70 years old.
